contents.title: How to video: The anti-contour
contents.description_html: You might have noticed, but contouring has become one of the biggest beauty trends of recent years (thanks in no small part to Kim Kardashian's make-up artist), and yet it is still one of the trickiest looks to master. While it doesn't look as though the trend is going anywhere, we decided to go in search of an alternative.
contents.description: You might have noticed, but contouring has become one of the biggest beauty trends of recent years (thanks in no small part to Kim Kardashian's make-up artist), and yet it is still one of the trickiest looks to master. While it doesn't look as though the trend is going anywhere, we decided to go in search of an alternative.

contents.title: Maxine Leonard and Valerie Wickes, founders, Beauty Papers - JWT Intelligence
contents.generated_title: Maxine Leonard and Valerie Wickes, founders, Beauty Papers - JWT Intelligence
contents.description_html: We see Beauty Papers as a political vehicle. That's not to be provocative, it's to make people think. Digital publishing has put a tight squeeze on editorial budgets, with the creative side of magazines increasingly subject to the dictates of clients and commerce. This situation was frustrating for makeup artist Maxine Leonard and creative director Valerie Wickes.
contents.description: We see Beauty Papers as a political vehicle. That's not to be provocative, it's to make people think. Digital publishing has put a tight squeeze on editorial budgets, with the creative side of magazines increasingly subject to the dictates of clients and commerce. This situation was frustrating for makeup artist Maxine Leonard and creative director Valerie Wickes.

source.title: Maxine Leonard and Valerie Wickes, founders, Beauty Papers - JWT Intelligence

contents.title: NUKED: SNP on Naked, Nude, & bad lighting...
contents.generated_title: NUKED: SNP on Naked, Nude, & bad lighting...
contents.description_html: durgapolashi: "Now, I mostly hate to be told "you're beautiful" when it happens at my most vulnerable, stripped-down, naked. When Drake's all about "sweatpants, hair back, chillin' with no makeup on," I do take that wrong, in the same way I always felt disserviced by Jane Pratt's famous"makeunders," the way they privileged "natural beauty," without ever acknowledging that "natural beauty" itself privileges the naturally, and conventionally, beautiful."
contents.description: durgapolashi: "Now, I mostly hate to be told "you're beautiful" when it happens at my most vulnerable, stripped-down, naked. When Drake's all about "sweatpants, hair back, chillin' with no makeup on," I do take that wrong, in the same way I always felt disserviced by Jane Pratt's famous"makeunders," the way they privileged "natural beauty," without ever acknowledging that "natural beauty" itself privileges the naturally, and conventionally, beautiful."

source.title: S N I P P E T S — NUKED: SNP on Naked, Nude, & bad lighting...

CV Dazzle explores how fashion can be used as camouflage from face-detection technology, the first step in automated face recognition.

contents.title: Lipstick Traces
contents.description_html: 15.95 List Price CLARICE LISPECTOR had a diamond-hard intelligence, a visionary instinct, and a sense of humor that veered from naïf wonder to wicked comedy. She wrote novels that are fractured, cerebral, fundamentally nonnarrative (unless you count as plot a woman standing in her maid's room gazing at a closet for nearly two hundred pages).
contents.description: 15.95 List Price CLARICE LISPECTOR had a diamond-hard intelligence, a visionary instinct, and a sense of humor that veered from naïf wonder to wicked comedy. She wrote novels that are fractured, cerebral, fundamentally nonnarrative (unless you count as plot a woman standing in her maid's room gazing at a closet for nearly two hundred pages).

contents.title: The Rise of the Streetwear Pussy Posse
contents.generated_title: The Rise of the Streetwear Pussy Posse
contents.description_html: Theroux and Hill link and build. Last fall, a new set of style muses began to capture the imagination of the celebrity gossip machine. "Feeling the Jonah Chill?" read a headline on the Daily Mail in late December. "Nothing was stopping Jonah Hill from getting his newly toned legs out as he enjoyed a sport of Christmas shopping in the big Apple."
contents.description: Theroux and Hill link and build. Last fall, a new set of style muses began to capture the imagination of the celebrity gossip machine. "Feeling the Jonah Chill?" read a headline on the Daily Mail in late December. "Nothing was stopping Jonah Hill from getting his newly toned legs out as he enjoyed a sport of Christmas shopping in the big Apple."

source.title: The Rise of the Streetwear Pussy Posse - GARAGE

contents.title: On Bacon Index - Sex Magazine
contents.description_html: Bacon Index makes their user/consumer aware of Kevin Bacon through an archive of imagery they post through their Tumblr alongside candid shots of their minimal yet bold designs. The performance of this archive comes across as absurd and excessive, something a driven fan might do.
contents.description: Bacon Index makes their user/consumer aware of Kevin Bacon through an archive of imagery they post through their Tumblr alongside candid shots of their minimal yet bold designs. The performance of this archive comes across as absurd and excessive, something a driven fan might do.

contents.content_html: Experimental Fashion traces the proliferation of the grotesque and carnivalesque within contemporary fashion and the close relation between fashion and performance art, from Lady Gaga's raw meat dress to Leigh Bowery's performance style. Francesca Granata examines the designers and performance artists at the turn of the twenty-first century whose work challenges established codes of what represents the fashionable body. These innovative people, she argues, make their challenges through dynamic strategies of parody, humor, and inversion. Experimental Fashion explores the experimental work of modern designers, such as Georgina Godley, Bernhard Willhelm, Rei Kawakubo, and fashion designer, performance artist, and club figure, Leigh Bowery. It also discusses the increased centrality of experimental fashion through the pop phenomenon, Lady Gaga.
contents.content: Experimental Fashion traces the proliferation of the grotesque and carnivalesque within contemporary fashion and the close relation between fashion and performance art, from Lady Gaga's raw meat dress to Leigh Bowery's performance style. Francesca Granata examines the designers and performance artists at the turn of the twenty-first century whose work challenges established codes of what represents the fashionable body. These innovative people, she argues, make their challenges through dynamic strategies of parody, humor, and inversion. Experimental Fashion explores the experimental work of modern designers, such as Georgina Godley, Bernhard Willhelm, Rei Kawakubo, and fashion designer, performance artist, and club figure, Leigh Bowery. It also discusses the increased centrality of experimental fashion through the pop phenomenon, Lady Gaga.

contents.content_html: The thing about a fashion photo is that its very function is to exhibit garments,” she says. “I think that now this is changing and it’s becoming truly collaborative. Holly would tell me, when she’s working with a photographer and stylist for example, that where the stylist might have once said ‘oh the shoe looks better now, shot this way’ or ‘the dress looks better this way’, now they say ‘that’s the best image’. And I think that’s representative of what’s happening today. Fashion isn’t front and centre anymore – it’s not the first thing you notice in these images.”
contents.content: The thing about a fashion photo is that its very function is to exhibit garments,” she says. “I think that now this is changing and it’s becoming truly collaborative. Holly would tell me, when she’s working with a photographer and stylist for example, that where the stylist might have once said ‘oh the shoe looks better now, shot this way’ or ‘the dress looks better this way’, now they say ‘that’s the best image’. And I think that’s representative of what’s happening today. Fashion isn’t front and centre anymore – it’s not the first thing you notice in these images.”

source.title: Is the Role of the Body in Fashion Photography Changing? | AnOther

contents.title: Of Another Fashion
contents.description_html: I was invited to write a short article about OF ANOTHER FASHION for a special issue of a relatively new academic journal, Fashion, Style & Popular Culture . My article, following the theme of the special issue on "curation", reflects on the collaborative methods and broader significance of this largely donated public digital archive of women of color's fashion histories.
contents.description: I was invited to write a short article about OF ANOTHER FASHION for a special issue of a relatively new academic journal, Fashion, Style & Popular Culture . contents.title: threadbared
contents.description_html: UPDATE: This post is now re-published at (in slightly abridged form)! OK, I take it back. For the last six years or so, I've written countless articles, essays, and blog posts criticizing the lack of racial and size diversity on fashion runways and in print editorials.

contents.description_html: nobody wanted there) showed off her models with snappy movements and attitudes. Excitement built with the black models, who really made the show. African-themed outfits by Stephen Burrows were free, whirling and vital. Halston, Bill Blass and Oscar de la Renta also showed well, and the world of fashion never looked back.
